gurmukhi: ibibiD ibrK blI Pl PUl mUl swKw rcn cirqR icqR Aink pRkwr hY
transliteration: Bibidhi Birakh Balee Dhal Dhool Mool Saakhaa , Rachan Charitr Chitr Anik Prakaar Hai ?
translation: The vegetation is seen in many forms like trees, creepers, fruit, flowers, roots and branches. This beautiful creation of the Lord unfolds itself in many forms of wonderful artistic skills.

gurmukhi: brn brn Pl bhu ibiD s√çwd rs brn brn PUl bwsnw ibQwr hY
transliteration: Baran Baran Dhal Bahu Bidhi Svaad Rasa , Baran Baran Dhool Baasanaa Bidaar Hai ?
translation: These trees and creepers bear fruits of different tastes and flavour, flowers of myriad shape and colour. All of them spread various types of fragrance.

gurmukhi: brn brn mUl brn brn swKw brn brn pqR sugn Acwr hY
transliteration: Baran Baran Mool Baran Baran Saakhaa , Baran Baran Patr Sougan Achaar Hai ?
translation: The trunks of the trees and creepers, their branches and leaves are of many kind and each leaves a different effect.

gurmukhi: ibibiD bnwspiq AMqir Agin jYsy skl sMswr ibKY eykY eykMkwr hY ]49]
transliteration: Bibidhi Banaasapati Antari Agani Jaisay , Sakal Sansaar Bikhai Aykai Aykankaar Hai ?49?
translation: As the latent fire in all these types of vegetation is the same, so do the God-loving persons find One Lord dwelling in the hearts of all the living beings in this world. (49)
